intro: Coprosma polymorpha, commonly known as the common kōwhai, is a native New Zealand shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for native birds. Coprosma polymorpha is often found in coastal and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. It plays a significant role in the ecological systems of New Zealand, supporting biodiversity and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
